title: Foundation: Degree in IT or Business
description: A bachelor's degree is the essential first step. A degree in IT/Software Engineering helps understand the technical side, while a degree in Business Management or Finance helps understand the business domain. A combination is ideal.

title: Entry-Level Role & Foundational Knowledge
description: Start in a role like QA Engineer, Associate Software Engineer, or Business Development Executive. This provides context on how businesses and software projects operate. Concurrently, learn the fundamentals of business analysis.
institutes: Any major IT or corporate firm in Sri Lanka

title: Associate Business Analyst
description: Transition into a dedicated Associate BA role. You will work under a senior BA, focusing on gathering and documenting requirements from stakeholders, creating user stories, and assisting in the communication between business and technical teams.
qualifications: ECBA (Entry Certificate in Business Analysis) - Optional
skills: Using tools like Jira and Confluence

title: Business Analyst & Professional Certification
description: As a full-fledged Business Analyst, you'll take ownership of the requirements process for projects. You'll facilitate workshops, manage stakeholder expectations, and ensure the final product meets business needs. Obtaining a professional certification is highly recommended.
institutes: All major IT companies and banks in Sri Lanka

title: Senior Business Analyst / Product Owner
description: Advance to a senior BA role where you tackle more complex, strategic projects and mentor other BAs. Alternatively, you can transition into a Product Owner role, where you are responsible for defining the product vision and prioritizing the development backlog.
